summary: This bill, the Federal Law Enforcement Officer Service Weapon Purchase Act (H.R. 2255), allows federal law enforcement officers, including retirees, to purchase their retired service weapons. The Administrator of General Services is mandated to establish a program within a year of the bill's enactment. Officers can buy firearms within a six-month period after retirement, provided they are in good standing. The purchase price is set at the firearm's salvage value, considering its age and condition. The bill defines key terms like "Federal law enforcement officer," "firearm," "retired firearm," and "salvage value."
